Steam (ST): When being beseiged, your true enemy isn't so much the fear of an unseen culprit... as it is keeping such fears alive for long periods of time.

Steam (ST): Maria got bored and started complaining that she wanted to watch TV. There was no TV in the lobby, so she decided to return to the cousins' room on the second floor.
Umineko Project (UP): Maria had gotten bored and had started making a ruckus because she wanted to watch TV. Since there was no TV in the lobby, she decided to return to the cousins' room upstairs.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Maria had gotten bored and had started making a ruckus because she wanted to watch TV. Since there was no TV in the lobby, we decided to return to the cousins' room on the second floor.
PC Japanese (JP): 真里亞は退屈なのでテレビを見たいと騒ぎ出す。テレビはロビーにないため、２階のいとこ部屋へ戻ることにした。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): [=JP]
Russian (RU): Марии стало скучно и она принялась шуметь, потому что хотела посмотреть телевизор. Поскольку в фойе телевизора не было, мы решили вернуться в комнату для кузенов и кузин на втором этаже.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Maria tinha ficado entediada e começou a fazer um alvoroço porque queria assistir televisão. Como não havia televisão no lobby, ela decidiu retornar ao quarto dos primos no andar de cima.

Steam (ST): The adults probably wanted to make sure Maria wasn't left on her own... They told all the children to go to the second floor cousins' room.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): They probably expected that we wouldn't want to leave Maria all alone. The adults told all the children to go to the second floor cousins' room.

PC Japanese (JP): 南條は初め、ロビーで本を読んでいたが、親族たちが内々にキナ臭い話をしたがっているらしい様子を察知すると、「お邪魔なようですな…」と言い残し、２階の自分の部屋へ戻っていった。

Russian (RU): Нанджо поначалу читал книгу в фойе, но как только заметил желание родственников поговорить о чём‐то зловещем, то сказал: "По‐видимому, я тут лишний", — и удалился в свою комнату на втором этаже.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): De início, Nanjo estava lendo um livro no lobby, mas quando ele percebeu que os parentes pareciam querer falar sobre algo sombrio, ele disse "Parece que estou atrapalhando..." e voltou para seu quarto no andar de cima.

Umineko Project (UP): ".........I'm starving. And if I keep just sitting around, my drowsiness will be even worse."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "............I'm starving. If we just sit around, we'll get even sleepier."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………腹ぁ、減ったな。ぼんやりしてると、それ以上に眠気が来るぜ」

Steam (ST): "True. My husband and I will remain here, so I ask that anyone having trouble staying awake take it easy and rest."
Umineko Project (UP): "I agree. My husband and I will be here, so anyone who finds this difficult should rest without overdoing it."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "That's right. My husband and I will be here, so anyone who finds this difficult should rest without overdoing it."

Steam (ST): "Our opponent might be expecting that, right? Even if they couldn't defeat this many people, if that number shrinks enough, they may plan to use that moment to strike."
Umineko Project (UP): "They might be expecting that, you know? They may not be able to defeat this many people, but if that number was reduced by a certain amount, they may plan to use that to their advantage."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「みんな“黄金郷”なのに、なぜかここだけ“黄金の郷”なの。わざわざ“の”が一文字混じるのよね。どうしてここだけ言い方が違うのか、漠然と気になってて…」
Russian (RU): "Везде написано 'Золотая Земля' ({ruby:ougonkyou:{p:0:黄金郷}}), но почему‐то только в этой строчке написано 'исток золота' ({ruby:ougon no sato:{p:0:黄金の郷}}). Он позаботился вставить иероглиф {ruby:no:{p:0:の}}. Меня слегка напрягало, что лишь здесь говорится иначе..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Mesmo que esteja sempre escrito a "Terra Dourada" ({ruby:ougonkyou:{p:0:黄金郷}}), por alguma razão neste único lugar está como a "Vila do Ouro" ({ruby:ougon no sato:{p:0:黄金の郷}}). Ele explicitamente misturou o caractere {ruby:no:{p:0:の}}, mudando a pronúncia. Me incomodou vagamente que esteja dito diferentemente apenas aqui..."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「大家都是“黃金鄉”，不知為何，只有此處是“黃金之鄉”。特意加了一個“之”字哦。為什麼光是這裡說法不同呢，稀里糊塗地就在意了起來…」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「大家都是“黄金乡”，不知为何，只有此处是“黄金之乡”。特意加了一个“之”字哦。为什么光是这里说法不同呢，稀里糊涂地就在意了起来…」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Nonostante sia sempre scritto ‘Terra Dorata’, ‘Ougon Kyou’ ({p:0:黄金郷}), per qualche ragione, solo in questo punto c'è la ‘capitale ove l'oro risiede’, ‘Ougon no Kyou’ {c:86EF9C:({p:0:黄金の郷})}. Si è preso la briga di infilarci il carattere ‘{p:0:の}’. Mi è saltato all'occhio che solo qua è espresso diversamente, in questo modo {p:0:郷} qui può essere letto ‘capitale’...
